item.title: Two 12inch potholes on Glendale Rd, DA8, 22nd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glendale Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London

item.title: The non cleaning of rubbish, tree leaves, dog and fox excrement. Has resulted in a very un pleasant place to park resident vehicles in. Including now two blocked gully type drains. Flooding the complete carark., 22nd February
item.description:
This carpark is always been missed by your street cleaning team, despite many times been reported by phone calls from myself. admittedly was cleaned once last spring. This is an on going issue over many years. Now result in the two gully type drains to block up resulting in a near impossible task of getting in you vehicle without get your footware /feet wet, with the flooding. Flooding issues was reported by myself in December gully cleaning vehicle came, saw left without unblocking drains.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Red Barracks Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Christmas tree in Benhill road, 22nd February
item.description:
Let's try this again, since you claim you haven't been able to find the Christmas tree that has been abandoned there for two months now. As indicated previously, the tree is at the entrance of Benhill road - coming from Edmund street - on the right, near flat 23. On Google Maps, it's here: https://maps.app.goo.gl/ji5DRLz5TnMXZkfc9 On What3Words, it's ///toned.kinds.known It's literally impossible to miss it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benhill Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
